ambiguity_notes: Some source PDFs contain extraction artifacts (spacing/encoding noise). Items flagged as ambiguous should be verified against original PDFs before high-stakes use.
Exact statute/rule numbers and certain numeric thresholds are inconsistently legible in extracted text and are intentionally omitted unless clearly readable.

subtopics.name: Categories and indicators
learning_objectives: Differentiate physical, sexual, and emotional abuse.
Define neglect as failure to provide support, supervision, warmth, acceptance, attention, and normal living experiences.
Recognize observable physical and behavioral indicators associated with abuse and neglect.

subtopics.name: Child, family, environmental factors
learning_objectives: Identify child, family, and environmental factors that increase abuse/neglect risk.
Use caregiver-child-family interactions to gather relevant concern signals.

subtopics.name: Mandated reporting
learning_objectives: State that every adult in Florida is required by law to report suspected abuse/neglect.
Explain identity requirements: child care professionals provide their names; others may report anonymously.
Recall that failure to report suspected abuse/neglect is described as a third-degree felony in source text.

subtopics.name: Available reporting methods
learning_objectives: List hotline submission channels named in source text: online, telephone, Florida Relay/TTY, and fax.
Select appropriate reporting path based on immediate situation constraints.

subtopics.name: Comprehensive and ongoing practice
learning_objectives: Focus on each childâ€™s individual traits and abilities.
Use comprehensive, multi-method information collection.
Apply ongoing observation/screening for earlier need identification.
Ensure observation and screening are purposeful and focused.

subtopics.name: Checklist, anecdotal record, running record
learning_objectives: Choose a checklist to track presence/absence of target skills.
Use anecdotal records to document events shortly after occurrence.
Use running records to capture behavior as it happens over short periods.

subtopics.name: From concern to referral
learning_objectives: Explain referral as directing child/family to professional services for further evaluation.
Initiate referral after need is identified via observation/screening and documentation.
Use timely referrals to support early intervention and best outcomes.
Communicate referral steps with families in a supportive, collaborative way.

domains.name: Child Care Facility Rules and Regulations

subtopics.name: Purpose and program types
learning_objectives: Describe the role of regulation in protecting child health and safety.
Differentiate licensed, exempt, drop-in, and evening care program concepts as presented in source materials.
Recognize alignment of statutes, administrative code, and handbook guidance.

subtopics.name: Licensure and compliance
learning_objectives: Identify annual licensure application expectations.
Explain the role of inspections for compliance.
Connect enrollment records and staff-to-child ratios with child safety.

subtopics.name: Daily safety operations
learning_objectives: Apply daily indoor/outdoor safety checks.
Ensure hazardous materials and firearms are inaccessible to children.
Recognize licensed capacity and usable space concepts in daily planning.

subtopics.name: Initial and ongoing requirements
learning_objectives: Recall the 90-day window to begin training for new child care personnel.
Recall completion expectations for 40-hour introductory training (or approved exemption pathways).
Identify required recurring training elements (e.g., literacy, fire extinguisher, and other named topics in source text).

subtopics.name: Violations, sanctions, and professional growth
learning_objectives: Classify violations by enforcement categories (Class I/II/III).
Explain sanctions as tied to standard violated, frequency, and severity.
Create and maintain a professional development plan with ongoing education.
